text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd chairman Gary Pemberton said on Thursday that the airline would not be making any significant acquisitions in the forseeable future.
"Acquisitions - they are very hard in the airline industry," Pemberton told reporters.
Pemberton said acquisitions were off Qantas' agenda as it focused on cost reductions.
Earlier this year Pemberton talked down reports the airline would bid for regional carrier Hazelton Airlines Ltd, but he did say that Qantas had considered such a takeover.
Qantas said earlier on Thursday that its cost cutting target had been raised to A$330 million from A$230 million to deliver profit growth in line with market expectations.
Qantas is 25 percent owned by British Airways Plc.
